moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. b3 d5 3. Bb2 Bf5: This is the first time I have had someone play a London-type system against my opening.
moves.4. e3 Nbd7 5. Nf3 e6 6. Nbd2 c6 7. Bd3 B: I am not unhappy about this position.  With good pawn play, I might have a chance to bulldoze the center.
moves.8... Bd6 9. O-O O-O 10. Ne5 c5 11. f4: Planting the Ne5 is a good step.
moves.11... Rc8 12. Rc1 b6 13. Ndf3 h6 14. Qe1: Undeveloping might not be best.  Black may be thinking about planting the N on b4, but it could take a while, and a3 might be able to stop it anyway.
moves.17. dxc5 Bxc5 18. b4: d4 also drives the B away, but allows Ne4.
moves.18... Bd6 19. Qd2 Qe7 20. a3 Rc7 21. Rxc: I didn't want to allow the R's to double.
moves.21... Bxc7 22. g4: After some delay, I got my pawns rolling.
moves.22... Nh7 23. Qc3 Rc8: Rc8 gives me an idea.  My B-Q battery can threaten checkmate on g7, so...
moves.24. Nc6: Black can't take the N because of Qxg7#.
moves.24... Qf8: This stops the checkmate, but it loses significant material.
moves.25. Ne7+: After Kh8, Black loses a full R and still can't recapture because of the checkmate threat on g7.
